review_title: Best perk you will get a sweater or bag at the end of the year!!!
pros: Best place for fake values on walls, super low turnover of employees (only 62.8% left this year), compensation includes lovely bag or sweater. Talent shows at meeting from mentors that eat can eat macaroons at one sitting with no help. Coffee is only $1 and pop is $1-2.50. Patties are under $2. Assigned parking when you are next in line after 2 years. You will only develop anxiety after 3 months. Sales is everything. You will learn to sell boats in a drought. You will learn how to work with a team and perform against competitors with 2.8 times the employee size and resources. You will thrive in a place wearing many hats (and end up not knowing what hat you started with). Mental abuse will happen only after 3 months till you leave.
cons: It’s a hidden treasure, you can’t believe someone haven’t told you about this famous school. You only wish you can work here till retirement with the best professionals in the industry.

review_title: Best and most rewarding job I ever had.
pros: The Instructor's care (all industry professionals) Great support from upper management.
cons: You get as much out of your students as you put into them, which is a good thing but be prepared to do quite a bit of paperwork from home in the evening and on weekends. Not a con really, just a head's up if you're also holding down another job.

review_title: Great comission, you have to do it their way
pros: commission structure is great if you hit the targets, work hours vary
cons: high pressure, bottom line you need to hit targets

pros: Great place to work.  Great policy of promoting internal advancement.  Great compensation.
cons: I can think of no cons.

job_title: Intermediate Software Developer in Toronto, ON
pros: Good work environment, Good Senior management
cons: Not comparative salary compared with market
